snippet: Detroit officials opted for state oversight of its ailing finances rather than an impending appointment of an emergency manager.
abstract: Detroit city council opts for state oversight of its ailing finances rather than impending appointment of an emergency manager by Michigan Gov RIck Snyder; some residents describe it as simply a backdoor effort by Republican-dominated state government in Lansing to attack unions; others see a racial element in notion that state authorities insist on overseeing the governing of a city where 82 percent of the residents are African-American.
lead_paragraph: Detroit officials opted for state oversight of its ailing finances rather than an impending appointment of an emergency manager.

headline.seo: Detroit Council Votes for State Oversight
headline.main: Council Reluctantly Agrees to State’s Oversight of Detroit’s Fiscal Decisions
headline.print_headline: Council Reluctantly Agrees to State’s Oversight of Detroit’s Fiscal Decisions
